comment.author: 50415738@N04
comment._content: I am sure this group would love this photo added www.flickr.com/groups/1118937@N24/

comment.author: 50415738@N04
comment._content: This ambulance was actually operated by the Central District of the NSW Ambulance Transport Service. The Central District was originally in charge of the Central Sydney (CBD) area, but gradually expanded to include all the Sydney Metropolitan Districts. The photo appears to be taken near Central Railway Station, where the ambulance headquarters were located. The lane is called Ambulance Avenue and is still there, just off Broadway. The NSWATSB was made up of members from the various District committees throughout NSW and was partly funded by the NSW Government. It was the fore runner to today's Ambulance Service of NSW.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/50415738@N04] Thanks for this extra interesting info. We have also added the photo to the group.

comment.author: 29995882@N07
comment._content: Yes, the photo is taken within the precinct of Central Railway Station.  It is just of Railway Square and in the driveway that takes you under the station itself, which used to be called Ambulance Avenue.  The building in the  back is the old Parcels Office and is now the Medina Hotel. The edge of the building on the far right is Marcus Clarke - another GREAT Sydney Department store.  Both buildings were completed in 1913 but Marcus Clarke had an extension done in 1928 which doesn't appear to be in this pic.

comment.author: 29995882@N07
comment._content: I don think this is 1930.  Apart from the Marcus Clarke Building the solid rubber tyres of the vehicles in the photo were not used post 1918.  I'm thinking this is more c1920-1925.
